title: WaPo works overtime attempting to bury what group's calling in bomb threats to Target. Hint: Not MAGA
description:
The Media Is The Enemy of the People (#217 in a Series). If a group is calling bomb threats into a major retailer like Target for political reasons, the political reason is the story. Unless you are Washington Post and the group ISN'T one that supports conservatism. Or even Donald Trump. When the group is LGBTQ extremists, that gets buried as an aside.

Headline: Target stores see more bomb threats over Pride merchandise. The clear implication it's the people boycotting the Pride merchandise calling in the bomb threats since they are the ones being attacked in the media.

Target stores in at least five states were evacuated this weekend after receiving bomb threats. Though no explosives were discovered, the incidents tie into the backlash over the retail chain’s Pride Month merchandise.

The first paragraph, and even I think it's MAGA extremists. Other than had it been MAGA extremists, the first two words in the article would be "MAGA extremists," as would the headline.

Second paragraph:

The threats Saturday in parts of Oklahoma, New York, New Hampshire, Vermont and Louisiana mirror those made in recent weeks in Ohio, Utah and Pennsylvania. In most instances, unknown individuals emailed the threats to local news outlets. The FBI and the regional Joint Terrorism Task Force have been assisting with the investigation in some jurisdictions.

SEVENTH paragraph, and they have spent more time writing about who is boycotting Target and angry at the store targeting kids than who is claiming to blow the stores up.

Target weeks earlier announced that it would pull back its merchandise for Pride Month after threats over this year’s collection. In a statement in late May, Target spokeswoman Kayla Castañeda said: “Given these volatile circumstances, we are making adjustments to our plans, including removing items that have been at the center of the most significant confrontational behavior.”

It is not until the eighth paragraph that we find out a message was sent to news outlets from those claiming responsibility. That message? "The message, which accused Target of betraying the LGBTQ+ community, named a store in South Burlington, Vt., and ones in Plattsburgh, N.Y., and in Keene and West Lebanon, N.H."

The fact it's LGBTQ+ extremists responsible is only mentioned once more in passing, five more paragraphs down. And it isn't just Washington Post.

\u201cThe media wants you to believe that a right wing terrorist sent bomb threats to target.\n\nThe bomb threats actually came from an LGBTQ activist who was upset that target REMOVED some pride items. \n\nYou would never know that from the headlines though!\u201d
— Libs of TikTok (@Libs of TikTok) 1686666951

This isn't just a Trump talking point. A vast majority of people who work in corporate journalisming corporation hate you and hate every opinion you have that disagrees with them. I'd bet all the money in my pockets that the reason they went into jorunalisming was because of that hate, and because they didn't think the media was biased enough.

>

<

Brodigan is Grand Poobah of this here website and when he isn't writing words about things enjoys day drinking, pro-wrestling, and country music. You can find him on the Twitter too.

title: Watch: Hannity forces Gavin Newsom to watch 90 seconds of Biden stumbles and he can't look away
description:
Gavin Newsom, who observers say is running a shadow campaign for president in case Joe Biden suddenly becomes unable to do so, sat down with Sean Hannity on Fox News. To make the point about everyone's Biden fears, Hannity had a 90-second compilation of Biden struggling to string together words.

\u201cSean Hannity shows California Gov. Gavin Newsom 90 seconds of Biden's "struggles," then asks him if Biden is "cognitively strong enough to lead this country against China, Russia, Iran, North Korea, and a new axis of evil."\n\nNewsom says he's "seen a master class in results" \ud83e\udd74\u201d
— RNC Research (@RNC Research) 1686619908

"I want you to tell me that you think he is cognitively strong enough to lead this country against China, Russia, Iran, North Korea, and a new Axis of evil," said Hannity.

"Sure, why not" proclaimed Newsom, knowing he got off easy. Hannity could have hit him with a 46-minute of Joe Biden struggles. And those were all BEFORE he was elected president. The elderly president is three years less coherent.

Unfortunately, that was the only Hannity highlight of the interview. He let Newsom get away with lie after lie after lie during the entire sitdown.

That's why Crowder did the fact-check on OUR show that Fox News didn't bother with.

title: Garth Brooks doubles down on his (kinda) Bud Light support: "Everybody’s got their opinions"
description:
Garth Brooks caused controversy with his clear implication that people boycotting Bud Light products were a**holes. The country megastar and new restauranteur has since doubled down on his comments. Albeit, with a little bit of a softer tone.

What did Garth Brooks say about the Bud Light boycott?


In an interview with Billboard that included "How His Nashville Bar Will Serve ‘Every Brand Of Beer’ in the title, while Garth didn't say the words "Bud Light" and attempted to give a politician's answer, it's clear what he was implying. When asked about his new Friends In Low Places Bar & Honky Tonk in Nashville:

"We’re going to serve every brand of beer. We just are. It’s not our decision to make. Our thing is this, if you [are let] into this house, love one another. If you’re an a–hole, there are plenty of other places on lower Broadway."

What is he saying now?


Addressing the controversy on a Monday livestream, Garth went with another politician's answer:

“Everybody’s got their opinions. But inclusiveness is always going to be me. I think diversity is the answer to the problems that are here and the answer to the problems that are coming. So I love diversity. All-inclusive. ... And if you’re one of those people that just can’t do that, I get it."

For the five of you who need to be brought up to speed, here are Bud Light's Keys to Derp:

  1. As part of Bud Light's NCAA tournament coverage, and to appeal to people who don't like either for some reason, someone at Bud Light decided to work with titface performer Dylan Mulvaney.
  2. Melissa Weinerchild, the (now former) VP of Marketing responsible, made it clear on a podcast how much she hated Bud Light's loyal fanbase, lashing out at them as fratty and out of touch.
  3. Bud Light fans from across the spectrum (NOT just the extreme right, we're not that organized) decided this was one woke pander from a company that hates them too many, and now Bud Light is no longer the #1 beer in America.

Garth Brooks is another example of why people should not address issues when they don't know the actual issue. The issue as reported on CNN and/or given to your PR team by the DNC is NOT the whole story.

People aren't angry at bars for serving Bud Light. We go to bars all the time and order something else. It was Brooks calling people "assholes" where the "controversy" started.

All Brooks had to say before was "we'll be serving all beer" and leave it at that. All he had to say now was "I stand by most of what I said, but the 'asshole' part was a bit much."

Garth should show more inclusivity by not being a dick to his fans and the people who actually support him. Spoiler: none of them are the people in the media praising him right now.

>

<

Brodigan is Grand Poobah of this here website and when he isn't writing words about things enjoys day drinking, pro-wrestling, and country music. You can find him on the Twitter too.

Massive Twitch gamers have been canceled by Activision for speaking out against the grooming of children. Also, did you know COVID was a bioweapon?! We dive deep into this story.

WUHAN LAB THEORY GETS WILD

  • Tom Cotton reiterates his suggestion that the Coronavirus originated at a super-lab in Wuhan

title: "The View" declares you can't call yourself pro-life if you oppose genital mutilation surgery for minors
description:
I somehow missed this clip from The View, but it's getting YASSSS KWEEN'd by the left. To be fair, I don't watch The View as much as I watch the clips Newsbusters's Nick Fondacaro tweets out. His clip of Ana Navarro claiming drag queens don't like kids distracted me. As part of that same discussion, we were informed we can't call ourselves pro-life if we oppose genital mutilation surgery for minors. And that we're the ones who are literally killing kids literally.

As a Louder with Crowder Dot Com website reader who is a) pro-life, and b) opposed to genital mutilation, I'm sure you are surprised to find this out.

“This the party that claims to be pro-life, yet the lives living here need the help they get, they say none.”

You are killing our children! You are telling our kids they don't belong. They are not welcome."

Let's set aside all the non-life-altering things there are laws against kids doing while they are still kids. Let's also set aside no one is killing anyone or telling people they don't belong. We're opposing the left's political push to encourage irreversible elective surgery on children. We are also declaring that no matter what the Democrat Party says, a seven-year-old does not know what's best for their life than their parents do.

\u201c.@AsmLoriDWilson says that if your 7 year old says \u201cthey are not the same gender as they are biologically,\u201d their belief must be affirmed, because to do otherwise would be to reject your child. She says parents \u201cshould be affirming our children in every possible way.\u201d #AB957\u201d
— Laura Powell (@Laura Powell) 1679510844

I'm curious if The View thinks the entire country of England is literally killing kids literally. They just followed Norway in blocking puberty blockers for minors. Three guesses why:

The publicly funded health service in England has decided it will not routinely offer puberty-blocking drugs to children at gender identity clinics, saying more evidence is needed about the potential benefits and harms.

The National Health Service said Friday that “outside of a research setting, puberty-suppressing hormones should not be routinely commissioned for children and adolescents.”

People under 18 can still be given puberty blockers in exceptional circumstances, the NHS said, and a clinical study on their impact on kids is due to start by next year.

American progressives have this weird thing about forcing and rushing "medical treatments" before they are efficiently studied.

We shouldn't expect much more from The View, aka the most trusted name in derp for low-information suburbanites. It doesn't change the fact the rest of us are on the right side of history here.

>

<

Brodigan is Grand Poobah of this here website and when he isn't writing words about things enjoys day drinking, pro-wrestling, and country music. You can find him on the Twitter too.

title: John Hopkins creates exciting new woke way to erase women in the name of science. Excuse me, I mean "non-men"
description:
Even though it's June when our government orders us to have Pride, it is not a very proud time to be a woman. Your government keeps forcing you to compete in sports against "girls" who went through male puberty and have a penis. A women's prison is no longer a safe space for you. Now, you don't even get lesbianism to yourself anymore. So sayeth John Hopkins University. AKA, The Science!

\u201cWhy is a lesbian a non-man but a gay person isn\u2019t a non-woman? Progressive misogyny.\u201d
— Arielle Scarcella (@Arielle Scarcella) 1686584485

It is unclear when John Hopkins University changed definitions. There is an older link that still acknowledges lesbians as women. But even on the rainbow spectrum the patriarchy reign supreme. A gay man is still a gay man. But a lesbian? That can be anyone who is a "non-man."

The newspeak here is enough to make Orwell scream "Dude! Too far." JK Rowling is saying "I tried to warn you people" as she does snow angles on the huge pile of Harry Potter money she got from the new HBO show.

Lesbian [sexual orientation]: A non-man attracted to non-men. While past definitions refer to ‘lesbian’ as a woman who is emotionally, romantically, and/or sexually attracted to other women, this updated definition includes non-binary people who may also identify with the label.

The updated John Hopkins glossary does not give a definition of "non-man." Other than your chad friend who claims he's not a homophobe because "he's a lesbian" does not qualify.

Also, I need to point out this blogpost is being written on June 13th at 8:20 AM and I have screen captures of what the LGBTQ Glossary looks like now. As more conservatives mock the cunnilinguistics it takes for John Hopkins to avoid letting women have sex with other women all to themselves, it is only a matter of time before the definition gets changed again. We've seen it happen with the scmaccine, book banning, a recession, and even the word definition.

I keep reading the phrase "LGB with out the T" on Twitter from Ls, Gs, and Bs who are sick of the other letters. This is another example why. Practiing intersectionality as a religion looks exhausting.

>

<

Brodigan is Grand Poobah of this here website and when he isn't writing words about things enjoys day drinking, pro-wrestling, and country music. You can find him on the Twitter too.

title: TikToker celebrates trans joy, takes "her" t*ts out after meeting Joe Biden as LGBTQ conquers the White House
description:
"You are the bravest and most inspiring people I've ever known," says Joe Biden as LGBTQI+istan usurped control of the White House. It was such a joyous event, trans TikTok influencer Rose Montoya went t*ts out to celebrate their trans-joy. Because the Biden Administration still hasn't learned that if you live by the influencer, you also derp by the influencer.

Rose Montoya is an Idaho model who started transitioning in 2016, which I think means boy to girl? I'll give Rose credit for one thing. Unlike all the male-to-female athletes and Admiral Rachel Levine, Rose at least tries to pass the eyeball test kinda. Since I'm sure many of you get your news from right-wing outlets and have a biased view of Biden welcoming the L, Gs Bs, Ts, etc. as conquering heroes, here's Rose giving you a behind-the-scenes look.

\u201cThis is what happened at the White House pride event. A disgrace to our country.\u201d
— Libs of TikTok (@Libs of TikTok) 1686615773


\u201cDecency is on the ballot.\u201d
— Dr. Jill Biden (@Dr. Jill Biden) 1603831741

This all happened after Joe Biden signaled his surrender to LGBTQI+istan and ordered the Pride Battle Flag to be flown more prominently than the American flag on what used to be the White House. Dylan Mulvaney is our new president now. 1776 called and they want their boring three-color scheme back.

\u201cSame energy.\u201d
— Louder with Crowder Dot Com (@Louder with Crowder Dot Com) 1686578310

This is where the extreme left (aka mainstream Democrats and media) claim boobs broke the extreme right's brains. Quite the contrary. On behalf of the entire right-wing spectrum, we love boobs. On women, where they belong. But even if this was a run-of-the-mill stripper going t*ts out at the White House, it would still be inappropriate.

Unless the girls were some of Hunter Biden's whores. If those were the circumstances, there would be no record of it happening since Hunter Biden is a figment of conservatives' imagination.

Decency is on the ballot again in 2024. Whether or not Joe Biden is on the ballot is open for debate.

>

<
